misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No clear misconception (code matches the required notional machine)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that nested loops can build the triangle row-by-row by printing i stars on row i, and that println() moves to the next line after each row.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There isn’t an apparent gap here: this is a correct mental model for how Java executes nested loops and how System.out.print / println work. The outer loop controls the number of rows; the inner loop prints the right number of asterisks for that row; println ends the row.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; output matches the specification.
